intro: Centaurium spicatum subsp. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese centaury, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a low-growing herb with slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers, which are typically tubular in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream sides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Gentianaceae family.
